SENT.plain: Thrombocytosis is a rare cause of ischemic cardiovascular and cerebrovascular events in patients with intrinsically normal coronary and cerebral vasculature

This report details the occurrence of inferior wall myocardial infarction (MI) consequent upon postsplenectomy thrombocytosis in a thirty-four-year-old man with angiographically normal coronary arteries
The MI was complicated by early left ventricular mural thrombus formation and embolic cerebral infarction
Combined anticoagulant and antiplatelet therapy was required to prevent the recurrence of ischemic events
